abstract: Kansas Gov Sam Brownback and other conservative Republicans, angered by State Supreme Court rulings that overturned death penalty verdicts, blocked anti-abortion laws and hampered Brownback's efforts to slash taxes and spending, say they hope to unseat four liberal justices in fall elections; similar partisan conflict over courts has erupted in 38 states where justices are either directly elected or, as in Kansas, face periodic retention elections, without opposing candidate.

headline.print_headline: Outraged by Court in Kansas, G.O.P. Sets Out to Reshape It
headline.main: Outraged by Kansas Justices’ Rulings, Republicans Seek to Reshape Court

snippet: The State Senate has passed a bill to authorize impeachment of justices based on their decisions, and conservatives hope to unseat four in the fall elections.
lead_paragraph: The State Senate has passed a bill to authorize impeachment of justices based on their decisions, and conservatives hope to unseat four in the fall elections.
